segment.text: The Sight of a Blinded Man
was the fifth day of my captivity –
although I will be the first to admit
that my reckoning of time had likely fled
– they tore the cloth from my mouth
trying to adjust to the brightness of the floodlamps behind that
My captors loomed behind the lights, anonymous and threatening.
Before me was a mirror, set into the wall next to a heavy metal door.
Rust pitted the floor, walls, and ceiling alike.
Crusty bolt heads dotted the exposed surfaces at regular intervals.
On the diamond plate floor in front of me was the cloth
that had been used as my gag.
The blood had long since darkened to brown,
but I still recognized it as her scarf.
I started to twist my neck around, anxious to glimpse the figures behind when suddenly the lights were extinguished
and my room fell into darkness.
Except for the dull glow of the mirror in front of me, which now manifested as a window, backlit from the other side.
The Lights go on at Night (Part Two)
Abbey, Seth, and Calvin—their little pumpkin suited boy,
but no one answers the doorbell.
Seth rings again, annoyed by the lack of response.
“The door is wide open, honey, I’m gonna give a holler
and if no one answers we’re leaving.”
“Hello, trick or treat, is anyone home?”
Big bold letters spell CANDY IN THE FOYER ,
HELP YOURSELF TO ONE PER PERSON PLEASE .
“Alright, Calvin, lets get some candy sweet heart.”
Abbey calmly ushers her son inside.
The door slams shut behind him
Specks of ceiling paint sift to the floor
Seth tries to secure Calvin in his arms
but the G force plasters him to the floor
as the house shifts from the earth
and lifts off at a speed unfathomable.
the window—Abbey sees Saturn reflect in his widening eyes.
You are the lightI am the shadowSitting in the glow Of your flameHanging
onTo the threads of lightThat encompass youMake you unattainableYet bind
I knowI will never be able to let goKeep me in your glowFeed
me those threadsAnd let me shine
When you arrive at her door,
Her dog scampers around at your feet
as you wrap her into a tight hug.
and you can feel her lips mold into a smirk
where her head is pressed to your chest.
and starting down the hall, pooch in tow.
“But right now, we have something more important to worry about.”
She stops in the middle of her bedroom, hands on her hips.
that I got for my birthday...just last night.”
But then, you’re not entirely sure
how you’re supposed to find the sparkle of a diamond in the sunlight, when all
you can really see is the shine in her eyes.
Noir and I arrived one day later,
the day before Alice was to turn 13, at the orders of the Queen of Midnight to escort her heir to the Night Palace.
that we didn’t anticipate, such as the fact
that her parents weren’t thrilled at having their daughter as the heir to one of the Nights.
They had already petitioned Noon about the decision,
and even though Noon had said
that still didn’t stop her mother from slamming the door in our faces as soon as she saw our Raven wings.
For a while there was the sound of yelling and doors slamming,
and then an entourage of hansom cabs drove up the road, containing Noon and his escort.
They were quickly admitted to the house,
while Noir and I had the pleasure of waiting outside in the brisk November air for another twenty minutes.
At long last, the door was opened for us by Noon himself.
as the swing picks up speed.
It is like we are two kindergardners at a playground.
I feel free as a bird
and suddenly I feel Chris stop pushing.
I open my eyes to see him standing infront of me.
He runs and catches me around the waist.
His hands a gently grasping my hips
like he is lifting up a father.
He says in a I-told-ya-so voice.
"I am glad, wanna do it again?"
and do it two more times
and he catches me just the same everytime.
after the thought hits me after the third jump.

His face brightens at my statement.
Wouldn't want you to be late for your date with Eeedddwwwinnnn."
I laugh at how he says Edwins name.
and leads me to his car.
I is ride back full of music and singing.
that I am actually going on a date with someone else after this.
he stops the car and stares at me instensly.
I say and get out of the car.
as I fumble the keys for the door.
he would have"¦ Kissed me"¦ or would he have.
as I walk into the door.
I hear my sister calling from the living room.
She didn’t want the her hopes to rise,
just to see them fall again,
I’ve talked to him long enough to tell
that he’s totally head over heals for you,
what she had longed to hear for so long.
me then just go ask him.
Kyle, in all his god-like perfection, was right behind them.
Oh no, oh no, OH NO !!!
What’s the worst that could happen?
So he overheard two girls talking about which one
It’ll probably just inflate his ego.
You always have such a sunny disposition of life.
Sure does, Janice thought rolling her eyes.
Lucy ordered in a soft whisper.
as she gathered her courage to turn around
she had wanted to for so long.
“Hey Janice,” Kyle said, a bit hesitantly.
“Hi... Kyle,” his name came out with some difficulty.
he asked trying to get a casual conversation going.
He still felt guilty about something.
She wasn’t going to make it easy, “Fine.”
while Lucy, dancing around like a monkey
who’s feet were on fire and eyes didn’t wuite fit,
finally breaking the painful silence, “um... well...
I had intended to ask you.”
“There was something a bit more important than flying monkeys.”
I looked down at my crinkled map and address.
I swatted an angry fly away
from my face, and wiped my forehead with the bottom of my dirty shirt.
and smelling my clothes made me remember to change
before I met my long lost relative.
I sure wouldn’t make an impression in this state.
quickly switching my dirty t-shirt and jeans for a plaid skirt and white blouse.
I repeated the memorized address over and over in my head
as I strode down the lane,
looking at the houses one by one.
My sweat glands were working overtime.
I walked slowly up the pathway to the huge stain glass door, with stain glass columns on either side.
anything was quite as important as flying monkeys,
“Seriously, I needed to ask you something important,
I won’t make fun of you,
I was scared of your answer,
his face still firmly facing the floor.
wishing that he’d look at her.
Janice was both shocked and hurt, “Why the hell not?”
I walk hesitantly into the living room
where my sister is surrounded by books in the middle of the floor.
she had been paging through on the ground.
And these are wedding dress catalogues."
gesturing at the many books and magazines around her.
I saw the perfect one for you."
this and I just stand in the doorway
watching her shift through the pile around her.
She looks like a child on Christmas morning.
"Hazel, it would just be gorgeous on you!
She points to the big picture in the center of the page.
"The halter top you show off your shoulders beautifully Hazel!
The tight fitted top would show off your flat stomach perfectly!
Oh and look at the back!
These three bows down the back are to die for."
but I couldn't stand to think about it!
Uh, shouldn't we be getting ready though?"
She throws the book on the table
and rushes upstairs to our now combined room.
I walk in on her saying
and go to the bathroom to start my hair,
I can do my make-up in my room,
but all my hair stuff was in the bathroom.
I pull my hair out of its ponytail
I grab a clip and section off my hair.
I plug in my straightener and turn it on.
I walk back to my room.
Amber is just getting dressed in a mini skirt and button down pink blouse.
"They're taking us to some fancy restaurant
I say before returning to the bathroom
Will you please leave me alone?
I really don’t want to talk about Andrew.
Honestly, I have nothing to say to you,
so please don’t bother me anymore.
No, I don’t have any comments.
NaNoWriMo Novel: Ch.4 Little Blue Dress
After my hair is all perfect, well almost perfect,
I have been saving this blue dress for formal date
now is the time to bring it out.
I look at myself in the mirror.
My dress had a tight waist
I put on my make up
and do one more check in the mirror.
I roll my eyes at what
she just said and make my way down the stairs.
Edwin is waiting at the bottom with a huge smile on his face.
He is wearing a nice white shirt and blue tie.
I show a glint of a smile.
She is wearing a pink dress
and flows just below the knees.
We picked these dresses out together one time.
It was a fun shopping day.
and we walk out the door.
I see a black cadelliac in the driveway
that I did not notice on my way in earlier.
Our father sent it for us today."
Amber picks a radio station, rap of course, and blasts it.
The whole ride is just filled with the blaring of rap.
I just stare out the window
Hopefully this will be fun too.
and they carry on after us.
As a father, I always wondered
I wanted to raise Andrew to be a stand-up man, a good friend, somebody’s husband.
In all honesty, I probably wasn’t around as much as I should have been.
I should have talked to my boy,
that he might be so alone.
mistakes- Andrew’s mother will be the first to tell you that.
I’ve paid for them with the one thing
We pull up at Andiamo and Amber glances back at me.
This is one of the fanciest restaurants around here.
and walks around to open the door for Amber.
Once she is out, Edwin hopes out.
and helps me get out of the backseat.
We follow Ashton and Amber up to the restaurant hand in hand.
I have really high expectations for the night
and don't want to be disappointed.
Ashton says to the girl behind the counter.
She shows us to a table in the back near a lit fireplace.
Edwin pulls out a chair for me
"Your waiter will be right with you."
Just then a very professional looking waiter walks up to our table.
as I see a white napkin draped over his arm.
He says, a strong British accent in his voice
taking Amber and me by surprise.
"So nice of you to come here for this."
"He came over to show the cooks our favorite dish.
Jeffery nods in our directions, "Hello Ma'am."
He says to each of us.
He asks turning back towards Edwin.
and then heads off towards the kitchen.
slinging an arm around Amber's shoulders.
Edwin then wraps an arm of his around my shoulders,
that is in my stomach from Edwin's touch.
hun,” my mother insited on the way to my new school.
you heard this a million times
before, i just came to a new town, blah blah, new school, no friends,
like the town of Marzark was way different than the others.
After I arrived to my dreadful destination
while sitting and all eyes were on me.
apparently wanting me to shake it.
After that everything else went great.
Jared introduced me to a lot of new friends and some really cool people.
I was actually starting to love school!
I kept looking for some flaw,
but nothing seemed to come up.
This school was just too perfect!
After school, Jared invited me to hang out with him..
maybe Marzark wont be so bad.
A legend older than time itself, is about to unravel.
or detour it from its set course.
All one can do is sit and listen to the tale
as it plays out on a screen much larger than those of the theater.
A story filled with adventure, conquest, agony, and relief descends upon this land, Amair.
We the faithful people of his highness must follow the rules
set for us by royal law.
We mustn’t and can’t allow our foolish hearts to divert our attention.
That is the fate of those
and that is how it has always been.
Until today, when a girl with a fiery disposition and a strong heart shall rebel against the empire, change the hearts of the city people,
and bring defeat down upon his royal highness.
This strong willed girl will fight harder
and will release her homeland from its suffering,
and forever leave her name in glory, Rain.
Sandra shrank down the hallway, folding her shoulders over her torso.
She hugged her precious spiral to her chest,
her eyes focusing on the feet trampling around her.
She moved slowly through the crowd of chattering teenagers,
barely hearing the squeals of glee over having a date for friday or who bench pressed more weight.
Selfconsciencely she ran her hand through her tangled hair,
that to the high school world it must look like a cat
puked up a hair ball on her head.
if the smoked filled room was any consulation from the hallway.

I’ve never left a trail behind me.
There’s no notes, no writing on the wall, no physical signs of affliction.
how to get under somebody’s skin.
I know how to mess with the ticking.
An odd thing, the human mind.
The most complex machine in the universe just... falls apart, if one can mess it up just right.
Most usually just go to pieces
I’ll have a toughened soul so helpless, so out of it,
he’ll fall to his knees & beg for salvation.
A few small scrapes on the back of the hand, or the shoulder, or on the heel.
& pour some of its contents onto the pearling areas.
What to Do When the Ceiling in Your School is Snowing
I rapped my fingers against my desk nervously.
I turned once again to make sure
and breathed a sigh of relief.
I didn’t have to worry about people
So I sat and listened to the dull whir of everyone’s bored thoughts.
Then I felt something on my head, like crumbs.
I brushed my head off to see white crumbs land on my desk.
Then more fell from the ceiling.
The crumbs were coming from the ceiling tiles.
Pay attention in class for once!”
Everyone looked up at that moment,
but of course the ceiling stopped by that time.
You’ve just wasted a good 5 minutes of learning.
Were all of the teachers out to get me here or something?
I stood there like an idiot,
and snapped his fingers infront of me...
“Gaahhh”I was startled by his snapping fingers...
and his face seems to light up.
ya, hehe, sorry, my name is Peyton, Peyton Dallas.”
I’d never seen a game of football in my life..
Its in room B11 , kay, lets go”
I walked with Aydan to Geography....

his face about to go back to the floor.

why... that’s why...” he just could get the words out.

Isabella Shae, a girl from Mebane North Carolina.
It was August 25, Bellas first day of school at CW stanford Middle school.
She was entering 7th grade and very nervous.
the year before Bella went to AL Standback Middle school, CWS ’s “rival” wich caused even more pressure on her.
Bella wasn’t going to CWS alone
though, a few people were leaving Standback, no particular reason for it.
Bella was glad to here from her new boyfriend, Tommy Warren.
They begain going out just two days before.
Will Bella make it through the new year
as a 7th grader at a new school, with new kids, wich ment new drama!?
This an idea i came up with for a story!
it could make a good story or not!
thanks and lots of love, sydney!
